title: Alberto Salazar ready for another long legal battle as he prepares to appeal four-year ban
text:
Disgraced coach Alberto Salazar will take his fight to clear his name to the Court or Arbitration for Sport in Lausanne if he fails with his appeal against a four-year ban for doping offences following a four-year investigation by the United States Anti-Doping Agency this week.

Sportsmail has learned Salazar has already instructed his lawyers to prepare for another lengthy battle after immediately announcing his intention to appeal USADA's judgement earlier this week.

Salazar was found guilty of three breaches of the WADA code which 'orchestrated and facilitated prohibited doping conduct' at a hearing of the American Arbitration Association, who gave him and Nike Oregon Project Consultant Dr Jeffrey Brown a four-year ban.

Alberto Salazar immediately announced his intention to appeal USADA's judgement this week

The 61-year-old is already appealing to the AAA, who have yet to set a date for the hearing, and if that is unsuccessful he will go to CAS.

Salazar is being supported by his patron's Nike, but has yet to receive any backing from his one-time star athlete Mo Farah.

Farah has said nothing beyond a brief statement expressing his relief that the case was concluded.
